page.title: 02TRAFFIC CENSUS, THATCHAM.
page.content: The A4 is a main road which runs in front of Francis Baily C.P.School. We did a traffic census when we observed and then recorded the number of cars, lorries, vans, buses, motor-bikes,push-bikes,coaches and farm vechicles. We went out at 9.30-10.00 am. and these are our findings: CARS 225, LORRIES 42,VANS 62,MOTOR-BIKES 3,PUSH- BIKES 5,COACHES 0 and FARM VEHICLES 2. We also went out at 1.30-2.00 pm and recorded the following:C-395,L-42,V-62 B-4,M.B-8,P.B.-5,C-0,F.V.-0. CONCLUSION:The A4 is a very busy road with constant traffic, more cars using it than any other vehicle.The A4 stretches from Reading to Newbury. During the morning more vehicles travelled towards Reading but in the afternoon more travelled towards Newbury.
